articles.title: Floral basket laid before Portrait of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral basket laid before Portrait of Kim Il Sung 
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- A floral basket was laid on July 5 before the President Kim Il Sung's Portrait which was hung on a wall of the building of the Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of his death.    At the floral basket-laying ceremony Ramon Pez Ferro, secretary general of the executive secretariat of the organization, said that it was an obligation and honor for the organization to pay homage to the President and that the President would always live in the hearts of the peoples of Asia, Africa and Latin America.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung praised by Indians
Group against "combined use of Chinese characters" formed
articles.content:
Group against "combined use of Chinese characters" formed
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- An inaugural ceremony of the information group to struggle against the "combined use of Chinese characters" was held in Seoul on July 6 by organizations including the "Society of Korean language", a South Korean newspaper said.   The participants in the ceremony criticized the South Korean authorities for forcing the combined use of Chinese characters from July, stating that the information group would undertake various activities to check the authorities' move and defend the Korean language in the future.   It is said that the information group would include more than 100 Korean language-related organizations and members of the computerized news distributing club.

articles.title: Large rally of Pusan citizens
articles.content:
Large rally of Pusan citizens
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- The Pusan civic federation for economic management and the Samsung automobile business bodies on July 7 held a large rally with the attendance of employees and their families of some 1,000 business bodies in Pusan and in South Kyongsang Province and members of civic organizations, according to a radio report from Seoul.   At the rally they opposed the authorities' unilateral integration of sectors and called for normal operation of the Samsung Automobile Company.   They denounced the "government" for pressing ahead with "exchange of key entities" intended to sacrifice workers and taking an action to liquidate the Samsung Automobile Company and urged the present chief executive to come out to solve the matter.   They declared that they would stage one million-signature campaign by the end of July in protest against the unreasonable steps of the authorities.

articles.title: Anti-corruption legislation demanded in South Korea
articles.content:
Anti-corruption legislation demanded in South Korea
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) --  Representatives of 10 civic, labour and human rights organizations including the Citizens Federation for Economic Justice and the Citizens' Federation for Democratic Society went on a sit-in strike in Seoul on July 5 in demand of anti-corruption legislation and the introduction of a special prosecution system, according to a radio report from Seoul.   They issued a statement demanding that the "government" introduce a special prosecution system and  an anti-corruption legislation at an early date.   They expressed their willingness to wage a joint struggle with representatives of over 180 organizations.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop meets foreign guests
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop meets foreign guests
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Vice-president of the presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK Yang Hyong Sop, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Society, separately met and conversed with a delegation of the Sri Lankan Society for the Scientific Study of the Juche Idea led by adviser of the society Reggie Padmasena Ranatunga, deputy Minister of Ports Development, Rehabilitation and Reconstruction, and the party of Jose Francisco Aguilar Bulgarelli, chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall  on Friday.

articles.title: "Collection of Legends about Kumsusan Memorial Palace" (1)
articles.content:
"Collection of Legends about Kumsusan Memorial Palace" (1)
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- "Collection of Legends about Kumsusan Memorial Palace" (1) was published by the Literature and Arts Press Group on the occasion of the 5th anniversary of the President Kim Il Sung's passing away.   Edited in the book  are 32 legends including "treasure of Kumsusan", "marvelous handbook" and "front-gate of star".   These revolutionary legends based on historical facts highly praise, President Kim Il Sung whom the Korean nation acclaimed and held in high esteem for the first time in its history spanning thousands of years as the greatest sage in human history and a great man born of heaven admired by world people.

Cohen's reckless war order
articles.content:
Cohen's reckless war order 
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- William Cohen, U.S. Secretary of Defense, issued an instruction to study the experience of the NATO air raid on Yugoslavia so that it might be applied to carrying out a new possible operation, according to an Itar-tass report on July 8.   This instruction was contained in a letter sent to the chairman of the U.S. joint chiefs of staff and other high-ranking military officers.   By a "new operation" Cohen, meant an operation to provoke a second war of aggression on Korea and his instruction was aimed at agitating for a new war of aggression.

articles.title: Idea of "aim high" will be immortal
U.S. senator and his party arrive
articles.content:
U.S. senator and his party arrive
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Robert Torricelli, U.S. senator, and his party arrived here today.

articles.title: Tortoise boat
Some suite members of Cambodian King leave
articles.content:
Some suite members of Cambodian King leave
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- Some suite members of Cambodian King Norodom Sihanouk -- Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, Hor Namhong, Minister of State of the Royal Government and Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation, Khuon Frang, member of the senate, and mom chin Huy, member of the national assembly of Cambodia -- left here today.    They were seen off at the airport by Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun, DPRK ambassador to Cambodia Kim Yong Sop, officials concerned, Cambodian ambassador to Korea Oum Mannorine and embassy officials.

articles.title: Wreaths laid for Kim Hyong Jik
Gifts to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gifts to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, July 10 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received gifts from delegations and delegates of organizations for the study of the Juche idea visiting the DPRK.   The gifts were separately handed to officials concerned by Jose Francisco Aguilar Bulgarelli, chairman of the Latin American Institute of the Juche Idea, head of the delegation of the Sri Lankan Society for the Scientific Study of the Juche Idea Reggie Padmasena Ranatunga, adviser of the society and deputy Minister of Ports Development, Rehabilitation and Reconstruction, head of the Jordanian delegation for the study of the Juche idea Mustafa I. Jaber, chief of the Jordanian Group for the Study of the Juche Philosophy, and Bewketu Tassew, delegate of the Ethiopian Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea.
